## Essential Downloads

### Liaison Obsidian Vault

Your complete knowledge management system for the Liaison Program. This vault includes:

- **00_Inbox**: Quick capture area for notes and ideas
- **01_Journal**: Weekly reflection templates (Connector/Troubleshooter/Critic)
- **02_Literature**: Centralized space for reading notes and citations
- **03_Project**: Active research work with codebooks and data organization
- **04_Resources**: Attachment storage for images, PDFs, and media
- **99_Templates**: Ready-to-use templates for assignments and documentation

**[ðŸ“¥ Download Liaison_Vault.zip](Liaison_Vault.zip)** - Extract this to get started immediately.

## Documentation & Guides

### Quick Start
- [Setting up your Obsidian Vault](#setup) - 5 minutes
- [Understanding the Liaison Program Structure](#program-structure) - 10 minutes

### Setup {#setup}
- Download the vault from [Liaison_Vault.zip](Liaison_Vault.zip) and extract it.
- Install [Obsidian](https://obsidian.md/) and open the extracted vault folder.
- Review the course-specific setup steps in [Setup Guide](../setup.qmd) to connect your workspace and enable recommended plugins.
- Confirm your vault sync/backup preference (local, cloud, or git) before adding content.

### Program Structure {#program-structure}
- The program runs through five phases: Orientation, Discovery, Dictionary, Execution, and Delivery.
- Each phase has a dedicated module page (see the sidebar) with objectives, tasks, and turn-in expectations.
- Start with [Phase 1: Orientation](../modules/01_orientation/index.qmd) to configure your tools and complete the initial journal entry.
- The [START_HERE](../START_HERE.md) page gives a bird's-eye view plus links to key checklists and timelines.

### Templates Available in Your Vault
- **Weekly Journal Template** - For reflective practice with three thinking paths
- **Data Dictionary Template** - For codebook creation and variable definition
